messages.subject: Re:  Michigan e-lists
messages.msgSnippet: ________________________________________________________________________ Hi Amy, What county are you moving too?  We live in Eastpointe which is Macomb county.
messages.messageBody:
________________________________________________________________________
Hi Amy,
 
What county are you moving too?  We live in Eastpointe which is Macomb county.  If you look at the palm of your right hand, we are at the bottom thumb knuckle <g>.  Our city borders Detroit - we "eastsiders" love this part of town, low traffic, excellent freeway system, all in all nice folk*s*.  Better than the other suburbs of Motown - horrible traffic, not "as" nice folks.
 
Anywho - I am involved in a group called Michigan-MacombCountyHomeschoolers.  We have an email loop on yahoogroups.  We do great stuff, bowl once a week, have parties, go to the youththeatre, museums, parkdays, you name it.  There is only one other unschooling family in the group - but the other families (approx 20) are very welcoming and supportive.  Let me know where you are moving too, and hopefully we can come up with some contacts.
 
Karen Mowery
 
PS. did you all look at your right palms to see where we live?  LOL
 
 
Message: 5
   Date: Tue, 6 Feb 2001 09:27:51 EST
   From: amycats2@...
Subject: Re: Michigan e-lists

Hello!
  I live in Toledo and we are planning a move to Michigan soon. I would like
to find a homeschooling list on yahoogroups for Michigan, but can't access
the website so I'll have to sub by email. Does anyone know of any MI lists or
could some kind soul look some up for me? (Not necssarily unschooling, just
homeschool in general would do)
Thanks in advance!!
Amy
Mommy to Trevor and Brenna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Michigan e-lists
messages.msgSnippet: If you can get to any websites at all, this one has lots of Michigan links. If you see one you really like here, but you cannot get to the page (and if someone
messages.messageBody:
If you can get to any websites at all, this one has lots of Michigan links.
If you see one you really like here, but you cannot get to the page (and if
someone from Michigan hasn't already hooked you up), write to me on the side
and I'll go back in there and see how you can directly subscribe.

http://www.gomilpitas.com/homeschooling/regional/Michigan.htm

Michigan Homeschooling
Associations | Events | Legal Information | Online | Resources
Support Groups | Support Group Lists | Universities & Colleges

Associations

Homeschool Connections
Striving to connect homeschoolers in West Michigan with the information,
support, activities, and events that will help them reach their home
education goals.
Information Network for Christian Homes
Serving Michigan's Christian Homeschooling Families since 1984.
Michigan Homeschoolers
We are a group of parents who love to homeschool our children. We represent a
wide range of homeschooling styles, religious beliefs, and incomes.
Southwest Michigan Homeschool Alliance
New site and webmaster for this group. Lots of sections with all sorts of
great information.

Events



Mid-Winter Home Educators' Conference
February 16 & 17, 2001, Sunshine Ministry Center. Sponsored by the Reformed
Bible College.
Clonlara Conference
Information is currently not available on our conference for 2001. The
conference is usually located in the midwest (Michigan or Ohio) and is
scheduled for the first weekend in June. Information will be posted as it
becomes available.
Scheduled Events
In western Michigan, from Homeschool Connections.

Legal Information



If It Walks Like a Duck and Quacks Like A Duck
By Susan Evans, HEM. Introducing and passing a new exemption for
homeschoolers in Michigan looked like duck soup to several individuals back
in December, 1995.
Michigan Legal Issues
A brief history of the legal situation regarding home schooling in Michigan
provided by Southfield.
Questions and Answers Regarding the State Regulation of Nonpublic Schools
Michigan Department of Education answers your homeschooling questions.

Online Resources



Homeschooling In Michigan
A place to discuss homeschooling in Michigan. Ideas, Links, freeworksheets,
lesson plans, etc for homeschoolers.
Mich_Homeschool
Online support group for Michigan Homeschooling families including the
planning of group trips and events. We welcome any and all Michigan residents.
Michiana L.I.F.E. Bulletin Board
Message board for homeschool families in southwestern Michigan and
northwestern Indiana.
Michiana LIFE Email List
All homeschooling families are welcome, whether you use a "school-at-home" or
"unschooling" approach. We are based in South Bend, IN but include all areas
of southwestern Michigan and northwestern Indiana.
Michigan-Macomb County Homeschoolers
This group is where we can come & find support, ask questions and even plan
field trips, for those of us in Macomb County, open to everyone in the
surrounding area.
REACHinMIHSgroup
For members of REACH Homeschool Group in Auburn Hills, Michigan. We are an
inclusive group open to anyone homeschooling for any reason with any method.
This forum will be used to share events, information and support.

Resources



Wanna make the most of your city? Citysearch It. Check out citysearch.com
today!
Content Standards
To help you design your own curriculum, the Michigan DOE provides
descriptions of what students should know and be able to do in the subject
areas of English language arts, social studies, mathematics and science.
Emmanuel Homeschool Center
Our service is designed to help Christian parents provide quality in-home
education for their children. Consulting, testing and custom curriculum
planning.
Homeschool Connections
Connects Christian homeschoolers in West Michigan with the information and
events that will help them reach their home education goals.
Information Network for Christian Homes
INCH provides a site for Christian homeschool families in Michigan.
Jeanne's Homeschool Web Page
Jeanne is a homeschool mom who is also a writer and a speaker. She has good
advice on how to teach your children to love to write. She also manages
Homeschool Connections, linked above.
Kids Stuff from the Michigan Historical Center
Try these activities that include real historic documents, things to make,
poems to read and more. They'll add fun and learning to your museum visit,
whether you visit online or in person.
Points of Interest
This page includes information on events and places of interest around
Michiana. It is an excellent resource for "field trips" for your family.
Rare Breed & Fiber Farm
Our farm is an attraction open to visitors who would like to see where fiber
is grown, "on the hoof."Â  We have a variety of rare
farm animals from many regions of the world.

Support Groups



Ann Arbor Area Unschooling Support Network
We offer information, activities, and opportunities to socialize and get to
know each other.
Holland Area Homeschool Association
HAHSA is a Christian network of families who have chosen to educate their
children at home in the greater Holland and Zeeland, MI area.
Michiana L.I.F.E.
A home schooling support group and network based in South Bend, IN. We are
open to all home schooling families of northwestern Indiana and southwestern
Michigan.
Reach Homeschool Group
We are an inclusive homeschool group that offers classes on a cooperative
community basis. Contact: April Morris. E-mail: c2morris@... .
Southfield Michigan Home School Support Group
Getting started workshops, Home school high school, Moms to Moms newsletter,
and Christian home schooling.

Support Group Lists



Area Support Groups and Contact People
Listed by geographical location within Metro-Detroit area. Those with an (*)
are CHEM members. To update, contact garykath@...
Local Support Groups
List from Michigan Homeschoolers. To be listed, email cindy at
Home2Teach@....
Michigan Homeschooling
List from Jon Shemitz.
Michigan Links and Support Groups
Extensive list of support groups from Michigan Crusaders.
Michigan Support Groups
List from Home Education Magazine. To be listed, email
HEM-Info@...

Universities & Colleges



Northern Michigan University
Provides a wide range of educational opportunities. Scroll down about half
way for homeschool admissions policy.
University of Michigan
Home-schooled students and graduates of unaccredited schools may be required
to submit the results of additional nationally normed test such as the SAT II
Subject Examinations.
